description:
The second season of Jibaku Shounen Hanako-kun.

Hanako, Nene, and Kou race against time to uncover the traitor among the Seven Wonders.

(Source: Crunchyroll News)
hashtag: #花子くん #花子くんアニメ #地縛少年花子くん２
synonyms: ฮานาโกะคุง วิญญาณติดที่ ซีซั่น 2

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Exorcism
tags.description: Involving religious methods of vanquishing youkai, demons, or other supernatural entities.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Steampunk
tags.description: Prominently features technology and designs inspired by 19th-century industrial steam-powered machinery.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aidairo2009)

__AidaIro (あいだいろ)__ are the authors of [Toilet Bound Hanako-kun](https://anilist.co/anime/108463/Jibaku-Shounen-Hanakokun/). They are a team consisting of Iro, the writer, and Aida, the illustrator of the series.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/256771/)._
*(Note: Not to be confused with the studio Pierrot producer [Youhei Fukui](https://anilist.co/staff/332315))*

__[Website](https://zingproduce.jp)__ | __[Profile (Cymusic)](https://cymusic.co.jp/artist/?p=702)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/zingproduce)__

__Formed:__ 2017

__ZiNG__ is a Japanese music and sound production unit featuring creators from different bands.

Members:
- [Nobuaki Katou](https://anilist.co/staff/164009/Nobuaki-Katou) (加藤伸明) from [My First Story](https://anilist.co/staff/127675) – bassist
- [Masatoshi Nakano](https://anilist.co/staff/164008/Masatoshi-Nakano) (中野正敏) from [Ling Tosite Sigure](https://anilist.co/staff/115154/) – drummer
- [Taki Yoshimitsu](https://anilist.co/staff/164007/Taki-Yoshimitsu) (滝善充) from [9mm Parabellum Bullet](https://anilist.co/staff/126805) – guitarist
- [Anchor](https://anilist.co/staff/156743) – in-charge of lyrics, composition and arrangement

__[Profile (Cymusic)](https://cymusic.co.jp/artist/?p=598)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/anchor_staff)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/anchor_sound/)__

__Anchor__ is a Japanese composer, arranger, music producer and lyricist. He is a part of the music unit [ZiNG](https://anilist.co/staff/156742).

__Height:__ 153 cm
__Agency:__ Racoon Dog

[Profile (Racoon Dog)](https://www.raccoon-dog.co.jp/talent/r09-kitou.html
) | [Official Site](https://kitoakari.com/) | [Twitter (Official)](https://twitter.com/kitoakari_staff/) | [Twitter (Personal)](https://twitter.com/kitoakari_1016/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kitoakari_staff/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCU_E2DHcyQu-Toohyd1vzRw)

A Japanese voice actress. She debuted in 2014, got her first main role in *Time Bokan 24* (2016), and has since received more leading roles. On October 16, 2019, her 25th birthday, she made her debut as a solo music artist under Pony Canyon. After the agency Pro-Fit shut down their operations, she joined the new agency Racoon Dog on 2022. 

**Non anime roles:**
- [Abukuma](https://anilist.co/character/228251/Abukuma), Hass, Isuzu, and Nagara - Azur Lane (VG)
- [Barbara](https://anilist.co/character/203315/Barbara-Pegg) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- [Silence](https://anilist.co/character/186429/Silence) - Arknights (VG)
- Rola - Shadowverse (VG)
- Sabrina - Memento Mori (VG)
- Ashley Graham - Resident Evil 4 Remake (VG)
- Pepper - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- [Celine](https://anilist.co/character/305904 ) - Fire Emblem Engage (VG)

__[Profile (Cymusic)](https://cymusic.co.jp/artist/?p=598)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/anchor_staff)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/anchor_sound/)__

__Anchor__ is a Japanese composer, arranger, music producer and lyricist. He is a part of the music unit [ZiNG](https://anilist.co/staff/156742).

__[Profile (Cymusic)](https://cymusic.co.jp/artist/?p=598)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/anchor_staff)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/anchor_sound/)__

__Anchor__ is a Japanese composer, arranger, music producer and lyricist. He is a part of the music unit [ZiNG](https://anilist.co/staff/156742).

__[Website](http://www.milipon.com/saku/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sinxix)__

__Saku__ is a Japanese guitarist, lyricist, composer and arranger.
Also the composer for the video game Phantom Kingdom.

__[Website](http://www.milipon.com/saku/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sinxix)__

__Saku__ is a Japanese guitarist, lyricist, composer and arranger.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.

__[Website](http://www.milipon.com/saku/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sinxix)__

__Saku__ is a Japanese guitarist, lyricist, composer and arranger.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ogura_koubou)

In 1977, Ogura joined *Kobayashi Production* and learned the ropes of art direction under [Shichirou Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/103964/Shichirou-Kobayashi). In 1983 he left and established Studio Fuga together with Kouji Oono and [Toshiharu Mizutani](https://anilist.co/staff/121908/Toshiharu-Mizutani). There he eventually left as well and formed his own 'Ogura Kobo' at Production I.G., where he trains newer art directors. He continues to be a major presence at Production I.G. as one of their most prominent art directors.

Ogura's style is, similar to Kobayashi's, rooted in imposing architecture, ambient colors, and Western perspectives versus traditional Japanese isometric perspectives. Ogura's backgrounds are usually urban in setting and has a less saturated color palette, and uses more cool than warm colors. Ogura's fantastical, European Kobayashi influence is easily seen in [Wings of Honneamise](https://anilist.co/anime/1034/Ouritsu-Uchuugun-Honneamise-no-Tsubasa/), and his later work has remained distinctly metropolitan, something that can be seen even in the rural [FLCL](https://anilist.co/anime/227/FLCL/).

Website | Twitter Introduction Masayoshi Ooishi is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer, arranger and guitarist. He is currently a lead vocalist and guitarist for the band Sound Schedule, which is a three-piece J-pop/rock/jazz band. He is also a part of the duo [OxT](https://anilist.co/staff/127401/OxT) (Ooishi x Tom-H@ck), with Oshima Tomohiro. Biography Since making his major debut as a vocalist and guitarist for the band Sound Schedule in 2001, he has left numerous works as a musician. His outstanding voice, which has revealed itself to be capable of touching the hearts of many, worldwide, and while having his performance evaluated by the people, as a part of a new band at the time, he got to appear on music-themed programs on TV, and on numerous unusual music stations, while also participating in festivals nationwide. In 2008, he made his solo debut as "Masayoshi Ooishi". His way of playing the acoustic guitar was said to be a masterpiece of its own, and as a solo artist to debut with that as a reputation, it made it all the more interesting for him. There are various ways to describe him as a musician, some call him a "hand magician", or a "one-person amusement park", some even say it's like watching a magic trick. Not only does he perform live at the country's floorboard, he also performs on the internet on sites such as YouTube and Nico Nico Douga, where he attracts lots of attention from all generations alike, but he's a lot more popular with the younger generation.
